channel.title: For the Dutchies (might be doable for English people with google translator)
channel.description:
So the Dutch intelligence agency has posted a Christmas Puzzel. It's related to cryptography and steganography mainly. The puzzel is in dutch, but I think a lot of them can be made by English people as well. You can find the puzzel here: https://www.aivd.nl/binaries/aivd_nl/documenten/publicaties/2016/12/12/kerstpuzzel-2016/Kerstpuzzel+2016.pdf
So I did the first 2 and I think googling the Dutch version of some words having to do with the theme 'Christmas' might help the English people trying this.
I'd say it being a foreign language makes it a bigger challenge. There is no guide besides what's in the file.

item.title: For the Dutchies (might be doable for English people with google translator)
item.dc:creator: anon79434934
item.description:
Yes and no. On paper they are an intelligence agency, but in reality they’re only there to offer intelligence to police forces in the field and not actually “spying” suspects.

If they did the latter, 13 November wouldn’t have happened.

-Phoenix750

Read full topic

item.title: For the Dutchies (might be doable for English people with google translator)
item.dc:creator: IoTh1nkN0t
item.description:
So the Dutch intelligence agency has posted a Christmas Puzzel.
It’s related to cryptography and steganography mainly.
The puzzel is in dutch, but I think a lot of them can be made by English people as well.
You can find the puzzel here:

aivd.nl

Kerstpuzzel+2016.pdf

1638.05 KB

So I did the first 2 and I think googling the Dutch version of some words having to do with the theme ‘Christmas’ might help the English people trying this.

I’d say it being a foreign language makes it a bigger challenge.
There is no guide besides what’s in the file.

Read full topic
